actions.actionTitle: Remove the learning period for alerts
actions.actionDescription: Configure Microsoft Defender security products to immediately generate alerts without a learning period for newly onboarded devices or users. This ensures that security monitoring begins immediately rather than waiting for baseline behavior to be established.

actions.actionTitle: Use tamper protection to protect security settings
actions.actionDescription: Enable tamper protection in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint to prevent malicious apps and unauthorized users from changing important security settings. This protects antivirus configurations, real-time protection, and other critical security features from being disabled.

actions.actionTitle: Deny account elevation requests from standard user accounts
actions.actionDescription: Configure User Account Control (UAC) and Azure AD policies to prevent standard users from elevating privileges without proper authorization. This ensures that administrative tasks require explicit approval from designated administrators.

actions.actionTitle: Establish lockout mechanism in macOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure account lockout policies for macOS devices managed through Intune to prevent brute force attacks. This includes setting maximum failed login attempts and lockout duration to protect against unauthorized access attempts.

actions.actionTitle: Disable 'Insecure guest logons' in Server Message Block (SMB)
actions.actionDescription: Configure Group Policy or Intune settings to block insecure guest authentication to SMB shares. This prevents credential relay attacks and ensures that all SMB connections require proper authentication and encryption.

actions.actionTitle: Set cloud-based anti-phishing and anti-malware app
actions.actionDescription: Configure Microsoft Defender for Office 365's anti-phishing and anti-malware policies to protect email communications. This includes setting up Safe Attachments, Safe Links, and impersonation protection to detect and block advanced email threats.

actions.actionTitle: Restrict anonymous access to named pipes and shares
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows security settings to prevent anonymous access to named pipes and network shares. This blocks unauthorized enumeration of shared resources and prevents information disclosure through null session connections.

actions.actionTitle: Require additional authentication at startup
actions.actionDescription: Enable BitLocker pre-boot authentication or Windows Hello for Business to require additional verification before the operating system loads. This provides protection against offline attacks and ensures device security even when physically compromised.

actions.actionTitle: Import physical badging data
actions.actionDescription: Integrate physical access control system data with Azure AD Identity Protection to correlate physical and digital access patterns. This helps detect impossible travel scenarios and potential security breaches by comparing badge-in locations with sign-in locations.

actions.actionTitle: Create a compliance policy for Windows devices
actions.actionDescription: Establish comprehensive compliance policies in Microsoft Intune specifically for Windows devices, including requirements for BitLocker encryption, Windows Defender status, and minimum OS versions. Non-compliant devices can be blocked from accessing corporate resources.

actions.actionTitle: Disable the local storage of passwords and credentials
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows Credential Manager and browser settings to prevent local caching of passwords and credentials. This reduces the risk of credential theft from compromised devices and forces authentication requests to be processed in real-time.

actions.actionTitle: Restrict access to privileged accounts
actions.actionDescription: Implement strict access controls for privileged accounts using Azure AD Conditional Access and Privileged Identity Management. This includes requiring specific device compliance, location restrictions, and additional authentication factors for administrative access.

actions.actionTitle: Display privacy statements for end users
actions.actionDescription: Configure terms of use and privacy notices in Azure AD that users must acknowledge before accessing applications. This ensures users are informed about data handling practices and provides documented consent for compliance requirements.

actions.actionTitle: Disable password storage in web browser
actions.actionDescription: Deploy policies through Intune or Group Policy to prevent web browsers from saving passwords locally. This forces users to use enterprise password managers or authentication systems and prevents credentials from being stored in less secure browser storage.

actions.actionTitle: Maintain segregation of duties
actions.actionDescription: Design and enforce role-based access control (RBAC) in Azure AD to ensure proper separation of administrative duties. This prevents single individuals from having excessive permissions and reduces the risk of insider threats or accidental misconfigurations.

actions.actionTitle: Manage software update policies on macOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure and enforce software update policies for macOS devices through Microsoft Intune. This includes scheduling OS updates, managing app updates, and ensuring critical security patches are applied within defined timeframes.

actions.actionTitle: Protect and manage local admin passwords for domain joined computers
actions.actionDescription: Implement Local Administrator Password Solution (LAPS) or Azure AD-based password management to automatically manage and rotate local administrator passwords. This ensures unique, complex passwords for local admin accounts and provides controlled access when needed.

actions.actionTitle: Route traffic through managed network access points
actions.actionDescription: Configure VPN or Azure AD Application Proxy to ensure remote access traffic flows through managed and monitored network endpoints. This provides visibility into remote connections and enables security controls for traffic accessing corporate resources.

actions.actionTitle: Enable 'Hide Option to Enable or Disable Updates'
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows Update settings through Group Policy or Intune to remove user ability to defer or disable updates. This ensures that security updates and patches are applied according to organizational policy without user intervention.

actions.actionTitle: Disallow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows security settings to prevent anonymous users from enumerating Security Account Manager (SAM) accounts and shares. This blocks reconnaissance activities that could be used to identify user accounts and system resources for targeted attacks.
